Configuration/python/pn_reweight.py

00001 #
00002 # Sample configuration file that can be used to run the PN re-weighting 
00003 # processor.
00004 #
00005 
00006 import sys
00007 
00008 # we need the ldmx configuration package to construct the object
00009 from LDMX.Framework import ldmxcfg
00010 
00011 # first, we define the process, which must have a name which identifies this
00012 # processing pass ("pass name").  Usually, this is set to recon.
00013 p = ldmxcfg.Process("recon")
00014 
00015 # Currently, we need to explicitly identify plugin libraries which should be
00016 # loaded.  In future, we do not expect this be necessary
00017 p.libraries.append("libEventProc.so")
00018 
00019 # Load the PN re-weighting processor
00020 pn_reweight = ldmxcfg.Producer("pn_reweight", "ldmx::PnWeightProcessor")
00021 
00022 # Set the W_p threshold above which an event will be re-weighted.  For the 
00023 # definition of W_p, see the processor.
00024 pn_reweight.parameters["wp_threshold"] = 1500.
00025 
00026 # Define the sequence of event processors to be run
00027 p.sequence = [pn_reweight]
00028 
00029 # Provide the list of input files to run on
00030 p.inputFiles=["ldmx_sim_events.root"]
00031 
00032 # Provide the list of output files to produce, either one to contain the results of all input files or one output file name per input file name
00033 p.outputFiles=["ldmx_digi_events.root"]
00034 
00035 # Utility function to interpret and print out the configuration to the screen
00036 p.printMe()
